page.title: 19NEW BY-PASS FOR PETERSFIELD
page.content: Petersfield is on the main A3 road between London and Portsmouth. The single-carriageway road goes through the Eastern side of the town, and traffic is often congested. A by-pass is needed at Petersfield because through traffic needs a faster road and also we need to get fast traffic out of the town. The by-pass will go through some peoples' houses and land, which is a problem. During 1985 there has been a Public Inquiry which shows that most people want the 'Green Route', which goes to the North and West of Petersfield. It will go through part of Bedales school, parts of Sheet and Steep and will affect half the farms in our block, but it will reduce traffic in a conservation area. Conflicting interests have caused considerable public discussion over recent years.
